snippet: Technology offers some family-owned farms an opportunity to thrive and compete with giant agribusinesses.
abstract: Technology has become a lifeline for many American farmers like Kip Tom, seventh-generation family farmer in Leesburg, Ind; Tom's Farms has expanded to 20,000 acres, from 700 in the 1970s, in part because by adapting technology like sensors on combines and iPhone apps for irrigation; those farmers who can afford the costly tools say they are helping them grow to compete with corporate agribusinesses.
lead_paragraph: Technology offers some family-owned farms an opportunity to thrive and compete with giant agribusinesses.

headline.main: Working the Land and the Data
